channel.title: [Pi] Killing Problem [Pi]
channel.description:
Okay guys, so I'm having a problem. I recently added a KillStreak system, and it works perfectly. But now, if you die by an npc, it says
"You have defeated (Your name here) and receive 150 PkP"
How can I make it so that it just gives you pkp whenever you kill somebody in the wild?
I think I need to edit this line, but I'm not sure to what.
[code]if (Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom != o.lastKilled && c.duelStatus == 0) {[/code]

item.title: [Pi] Killing Problem [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

Anytime. If you have questions pertaining the source that doesn’t really require a full in-depth explanation, or code snippets, feel free to shoot me a message. Just please don’t like spam me with multiple messages. If you have multiple questions, ask them all at once, or post a topic and link me to it if you’ve not received proper help.
Cheers!

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Killing Problem [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

The code will not reference the npc whatsoever. The applyDead method creates an client object for both killer/killed.

Since the killer was not a player, the killerId is still null/not initialized and will therefore return the same client object as the killed. (This the message “you killed yourself Lul fag” etc)

Simply say, if (client.playerId != client2.playerId) etc

That’s all that’s really necessary.

Read full topic

Please read the above comment
[/quote]

How would I express the npc? For example, the player who was killed would be expressed as “c” and the killer would be expressed as “o”, what would the npc be expressed as?[/quote]Whatever you define it as.

item.title: [Pi] Killing Problem [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Null Amount:

Post the snippet of code that relates to the “You have defeated…” message and when it gets sent.

if (Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom != o.lastKilled && c.duelStatus == 0) { if (o.killStreak < 5) { o.killStreak += 1; o.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Current Kill Streak: @whi@(@red@" + o.killStreak + "@whi@)", 7334); o.sendMessage("You have defeated " + c.playerName + ", you recieve 150 Pk Points."); o.getItems().addItem(3706, 150); o.lastKilled = Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom; }

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Killing Problem [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

well you know how the applyDead() method creates two client objects? one for the killer, one for the killed? (clearly because they both usually get separate messages “you killed x”, “you were killed by y” etc.)

well, simply make a statement saying the playerId of the killer client object cannot be the same as the playerId of the killed client object.

Read full topic
